Subjective tests: for screening (sound sources, voice, pure tone audiometry)

Objective screening tests: OEAP and PEAA

Tests for diagnostic confirmation by an ENT specialist

- audiogram: tone audiometry requiring the child's cooperation (subjective)

- Auditory evoked potentials (objective)

question.title: What type of hearing test is used for diagnostic confirmation by an ENT specialist?

option_a.title: Pure tone audiometry
option_a.description: A test that requires the child's cooperation

option_b.title: Auditory evoked potentials
option_b.description: A test that does not require the child's cooperation

option_c.title: Tone audiometry
option_c.description: A test that requires the child's cooperation

option_d.title: Auditory brainstem response
option_d.description: A test that does not require the child's cooperation

correct_option.title: B
correct_option.description: The letter corresponding to the correct option
